pageContext.claim: ““The Washington Post ignored basic journalistic standards because it wanted to advance its well-known and easily documented biased agenda against President Donald J. Trump.” Covington student suing WAPO. Go get them Nick. Fake News!”
pageContext.analysis: We'll let the courts decide the merits of Covington Catholic High School student Nicholas Sandmann's claim. However, Trump's definition of "fake news" is that it is negative, not that it accurately reflects what happened. People in the news business have a different definition of fake news -- things that did not happen. Reporters do make mistakes, but responsible news organizations correct them.Similarly, we don't award Pinocchios when a politician acknowledges they misspoke. Plus, The Post is not biased for or against any politician including President Trump.
